intro: Eurycoma longifolia subsp. eglandulosa, commonly known as the Malayan dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and pinnate leaves. The plant typically grows in lowland areas and is often found in secondary forests and along roadsides. It is known for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional herbal remedies. Its root is commonly used in folk medicine for its purported health benefits.
